comment: She is very helpful, gives great feedback and responds very quickly. She genuinely wants students to learn the language and if you are willing to put in the work, she will be there to help you every step of the way.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: The professor was great, clear rubrics and scheduling. I do suggest asking or partaking in the professor's in person/virtual study sessions if those exist when you take the class. Immersion in the francophone culture outside of the homework will help immensely by the way!

Professor Swami is dedicated to constructive feedback and immersing the students in the language. Because of this, students who participate little, don't engage themselves outside of the class, or any other lack of effort in learning will find themselves receiving low grades. The content isn't hard, but new languages will require some effort.

Dr. Swami is one of the nicest professors I've ever had. You can really tell that she cares about her students' success and happiness. I've been in French classes on and off for a few years, but I never felt confident in my speaking abilities until this class. Dr. Swami made us feel very comfortable participating and learning through mistakes.

Dr. Swami is one of the most caring professors I have ever had. She will work with you on trying to get your french to the next level and will understand your level of french while she works with you! Her class was absolutely a blast with fun and interactive projects to not only challenge you but makes you want to learn more!

Prof. Swami is one of the best French professors I have ever had. Her classes focus mostly on practicing your speaking and all other homework is on VHL. She is incredibly fun, understanding, and ready to help you with whatever you may need. I definitely recommend taking her especially if you are already at a higher level in French.

Professor Swami doesn't teach her students. All she gives you is the textbook with assignments. She has mandatory interviews with her and makes you do group skits when it is an online class. Her tests are insane because she adds matching questions where the questions are so vague that any answer choice could go with the question. Do not take her!

she's really sweet, but was really test and quiz heavy. I never really learned anything in this class, I taught myself. Test and quizzes had lockdown browser and also essays. lecture heavy, class Was mandatory, lots of group work, participation matters. I knew all the information before entering this class and still didn't get a good grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: She is really nice during lectures. She makes sure you understand the material

She was a true angel. One of the best teachers I had. She was understanding and caring. Try your best and talk to her and you will learn French and get an A. But you do have to keep up with hw it closes at the start of class and their are no reminders when hw is posted.

She ensured that we understood the content before moving on to the next lesson. She was very understanding and worked with us on late assignments or redoing projects for a better grade. Assignments were online homework, presentations, quizzes and tests. The tests were only one sheet, front and back. We listened to music and also discussed culture.

If you're looking for an easy class and still want to learn then take her! She is one of the sweetest profs I have ever had and so understanding. You can miss one class unexcused and then she takes points off your attendance which is like 5%. Easy tests with bonus questions, 2 presentations, and light homework.

Swami is really great French teacher. You have 4 tests and 4 little easy essays if you prepare and a final. The homework is online. You need to book for this class. She is really funny and is always willing to help. Also, very understanding if you need to miss class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.
